* [`gnomish::application`](#gnomish--application): The `gnomish::application` definition is used to manage application icons on both desktops, Gnome and Mate.

* [`gnomish::mate::mateconftool_2`](#gnomish--mate--mateconftool_2): Defined type that is used to configure Mate system settings utilizing `mateconftool-2`.

## Classes

### <a name="gnomish"></a>`gnomish`

The `gnomish` class is used to configure application icons and settings that are valid for both desktops.
Besides that, you can also manage wallpaper, packages, and which file to be used to save user settings.

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `gnomish` class:

* [`applications`](#-gnomish--applications)
* [`applications_hiera_merge`](#-gnomish--applications_hiera_merge)
* [`desktop`](#-gnomish--desktop)
* [`gconf_name`](#-gnomish--gconf_name)
* [`packages_add`](#-gnomish--packages_add)
* [`packages_remove`](#-gnomish--packages_remove)
* [`settings_xml`](#-gnomish--settings_xml)
* [`settings_xml_hiera_merge`](#-gnomish--settings_xml_hiera_merge)
* [`wallpaper_path`](#-gnomish--wallpaper_path)
* [`wallpaper_source`](#-gnomish--wallpaper_source)

##### <a name="-gnomish--applications"></a>`applications`

Data type: `Hash`

Specify applications icons that will be passed to the `gnomish::applications` defined type.
For a full description please read on at the application defined type.
Hint: if you want to pass parameters from manifests, you will need to set `$gnomish::applications_hiera_merge` to false.

Default value: `{}`

##### <a name="-gnomish--applications_hiera_merge"></a>`applications_hiera_merge`

Data type: `Boolean`

If set to true hiera_merge will be used to collect and concatenate applications settings from all applicable hiera levels.
If set to false only the most specific hiera data will be used.
Hint: if you want to pass parameters from manifests you will need to set it to false.

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-gnomish--desktop"></a>`desktop`

Data type: `Enum['gnome', 'mate']`

Used to decide which desktop should be configured. Valid values are gnome and mate.
Depending on this setting the module will include the subclass `gnomish::gnome` or `gnomish::mate`.

Default value: `'gnome'`

##### <a name="-gnomish--gconf_name"></a>`gconf_name`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

This setting allows you to define system-wide which file should be used to save user settings. With this you can
completely separate the settings between desktops and even OS families to avoid spillover effects.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-gnomish--packages_add"></a>`packages_add`

Data type: `Array`

Name of package(s) you want to add. Use to add packages that are needed. Useful to add desktop specific packages.

Default value: `[]`

##### <a name="-gnomish--packages_remove"></a>`packages_remove`

Data type: `Array`

Name of package(s) you want to remove. Use to remove packages that are unwanted on a terminal server for example.

Default value: `[]`

##### <a name="-gnomish--settings_xml"></a>`settings_xml`

Data type: `Hash`

Specify desktop settings that will be passed to the `gnomish::gnome::gconftool_2` or `gnomish::mate::mateconftool_2`
defined types, depending on the value of `$gnomish::desktop`. For a full description please read on at the
gconftool_2 or mateconftools_2 defined types.
Hint: if you want to pass parameters from manifests you will need to set `$settings_xml_hiera_merge` to false.

Default value: `{}`

##### <a name="-gnomish--settings_xml_hiera_merge"></a>`settings_xml_hiera_merge`

Data type: `Boolean`

If set to true hiera_merge will be used to collect and concatenate desktop settings from all applicable hiera levels.
If set to false only the most specific hiera data will be used.
Hint: if you want to pass parameters from manifests you will need to set $settings_xml_hiera_merge to false.

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-gnomish--wallpaper_path"></a>`wallpaper_path`

Data type: `Optional[Stdlib::Absolutepath]`

Specify an absolute path to an image file that should be used as system default background.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-gnomish--wallpaper_source"></a>`wallpaper_source`

Data type: `Optional[Optional[Stdlib::Filesource]]`

When set, the module will copy the file from the given source to the path defined in `$gnomish::wallpaper_path`
(which obviously become mandatory then). Takes all values that are valid for the source attribute of a file resource.

Default value: `undef`

### <a name="gnomish--gnome"></a>`gnomish::gnome`

The `gnomish::gnome` class is used to configure application icons and settings that are valid
for Mate desktops only. Additional you can manage the system items menu file.

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `gnomish::gnome` class:

* [`applications`](#-gnomish--gnome--applications)
* [`applications_hiera_merge`](#-gnomish--gnome--applications_hiera_merge)
* [`settings_xml`](#-gnomish--gnome--settings_xml)
* [`settings_xml_hiera_merge`](#-gnomish--gnome--settings_xml_hiera_merge)
* [`system_items_modify`](#-gnomish--gnome--system_items_modify)
* [`system_items_path`](#-gnomish--gnome--system_items_path)
* [`system_items_source`](#-gnomish--gnome--system_items_source)

##### <a name="-gnomish--gnome--applications"></a>`applications`

Data type: `Hash`

Specify applications icons that will be passed to the gnomish::applications defined type.
For a full description please read on at the application defined type.
Hint: if you want to pass parameters from manifests, you will need to set
`$gnomish::gnome::applications_hiera_merge` to false.

Default value: `{}`

##### <a name="-gnomish--gnome--applications_hiera_merge"></a>`applications_hiera_merge`

Data type: `Boolean`

If set to true hiera_merge will be used to collect and concatenate applications settings
from all applicable hiera levels. If set to false only the most specific hiera data will be used.
Hint: if you want to pass parameters from manifests you will need to set it to false.

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-gnomish--gnome--settings_xml"></a>`settings_xml`

Data type: `Hash`

Specify desktop settings that will be passed to the `gnomish::gnome::gconftool_2` defined type.
For a full description please read on at the gconftools_2 defined type.
Hint: if you want to pass parameters from manifests you will need to set $settings_xml_hiera_merge to false.

Default value: `{}`

##### <a name="-gnomish--gnome--settings_xml_hiera_merge"></a>`settings_xml_hiera_merge`

Data type: `Boolean`

If set to true hiera_merge will be used to collect and concatenate desktop settings from all applicable
hiera levels. If set to false only the most specific hiera data will be used.
Hint: if you want to pass parameters from manifests you will need to set $settings_xml_hiera_merge to false.

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-gnomish--gnome--system_items_modify"></a>`system_items_modify`

Data type: `Boolean`

If set to true it will activate the modification of the system items menu file in
/usr/share/gnome-main-menu/system-items.xbel. The module delivers an example for SLE11 with a typical
reduction useful for terminal servers.

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-gnomish--gnome--system_items_path"></a>`system_items_path`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

Specify an absolute path to the system-items.xbel file which should get managed.
Hint: if you want to pass parameters from manifests you will need to set $settings_xml_hiera_merge to false.

Default value: `'/usr/share/gnome-main-menu/system-items.xbel'`

##### <a name="-gnomish--gnome--system_items_source"></a>`system_items_source`

Data type: `Stdlib::Filesource`

Specify the source of the file to be copied to $system_items_path. Takes all values that are valid for the
source attribute of a file resource.

Default value: `'puppet:///modules/gnomish/gnome/SLE11-system-items.xbel.erb'`

### <a name="gnomish--mate"></a>`gnomish::mate`

Used to configure application icons and settings that are valid for Mate desktops only.

#### Examples

##### Hiera Example

```puppet
gnomish::mate::applications:
  'mc':
    ensure:           'file'
    entry_categories: 'System;FileManager;'
    entry_exec:       'mc'
    entry_icon:       'mc'
    entry_name:       'Midnight Commander'
    entry_terminal:   false

gnomish::mate::applications:
  'mate-network-properties':
    ensure: 'absent'

The above will add a application icon for Midnight Commander in the file
/usr/share/applications/mc.desktop and remove the icon for mate-network-properties.
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `gnomish::mate` class:

* [`applications`](#-gnomish--mate--applications)
* [`applications_hiera_merge`](#-gnomish--mate--applications_hiera_merge)
* [`settings_xml`](#-gnomish--mate--settings_xml)
* [`settings_xml_hiera_merge`](#-gnomish--mate--settings_xml_hiera_merge)

##### <a name="-gnomish--mate--applications"></a>`applications`

Data type: `Hash`

Specify applications icons that will be passed to the `gnomish::applications` defined type.
For a full description please read on at the application defined type.
Hint: if you want to pass parameters from manifests, you will need to set
`$gnomish::mate::applications_hiera_merge` to false.

Default value: `{}`

##### <a name="-gnomish--mate--applications_hiera_merge"></a>`applications_hiera_merge`

Data type: `Boolean`

If set to true hiera_merge will be used to collect and concatenate applications settings from
all applicable hiera levels. If set to false only the most specific hiera data will be used.
Hint: if you want to pass parameters from manifests you will need to set it to false.

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-gnomish--mate--settings_xml"></a>`settings_xml`

Data type: `Hash`

Specify desktop settings that will be passed to the `gnomish::mate::mateconftool_2` defined type.
For a full description please read on at the `mateconftools_2` defined type.
Hint: if you want to pass parameters from manifests you will need to set `$settings_xml_hiera_merge` to false.

Default value: `{}`

##### <a name="-gnomish--mate--settings_xml_hiera_merge"></a>`settings_xml_hiera_merge`

Data type: `Boolean`

If set to true hiera_merge will be used to collect and concatenate desktop settings from all
applicable hiera levels. If set to false only the most specific hiera data will be used.
Hint: if you want to pass parameters from manifests you will need to set `$settings_xml_hiera_merge` to false.

Default value: `true`

## Defined types

### <a name="gnomish--application"></a>`gnomish::application`

The `gnomish::application` define is used to manage application icons on both desktops, Gnome and Mate.
The minimum set of entries for application icons (Name, Icon, Exec, Categories, Type and Terminal) have
to be set with the corresponding parameters. All others entries can be managed as an array of free text
lines via the $entry_lines parameter. The module will ensure that there are no duplicate entries and fail
if found one.

When applications get added or removed, it will call update-desktop-database. This will update the cache
database of MIME types handled by desktop files.

Instead of calling this define directly, it is recommended to specify `$gnomish::applications`,
`$gnomish::gnome::applications` or `$gnomish::mate::applications` from hiera as a hash of group resources.
`create_resources()` will create resources out of your hash.

The above will add a application icon for Midnight Commander in the file /usr/share/applications/mc.desktop
on both desktops. Only on Gnome it will remove the icon for gnome-network-properties and only on Mate the
equivalent called mate-network-properties.

#### Examples

##### Hiera Example

```puppet
gnomish::applications:
  'mc':
    ensure:           'file'
    entry_categories: 'System;FileManager;'
    entry_exec:       'mc'
    entry_icon:       'mc'
    entry_name:       'Midnight Commander'
    entry_terminal:   false

gnomish::gnome::applications:
  'gnome-network-properties':
    ensure: 'absent'

gnomish::mate::applications:
  'mate-network-properties':
    ensure: 'absent'
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `gnomish::application` defined type:

* [`ensure`](#-gnomish--application--ensure)
* [`path`](#-gnomish--application--path)
* [`entry_categories`](#-gnomish--application--entry_categories)
* [`entry_exec`](#-gnomish--application--entry_exec)
* [`entry_icon`](#-gnomish--application--entry_icon)
* [`entry_lines`](#-gnomish--application--entry_lines)
* [`entry_name`](#-gnomish--application--entry_name)
* [`entry_terminal`](#-gnomish--application--entry_terminal)
* [`entry_type`](#-gnomish--application--entry_type)
* [`entry_mimetype`](#-gnomish--application--entry_mimetype)

##### <a name="-gnomish--application--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Enum['absent', 'file']`

This setting can be used to add or remove application icons. Valid values are file and absent. Use the
default of file to add/manage them or set it to absent to remove them. If set to absent
$entry_categories, $entry_exec and $entry_icon become unused and optional.

Default value: `'file'`

##### <a name="-gnomish--application--path"></a>`path`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

Specify an absolute path to the desktop file containing the application icon. If not explicitly set,
'/usr/share/applications/' plus the resource title you have chosen while calling the defined type
plus '.desktop' will be used.

Default value: `"/usr/share/applications/${name}.desktop"`

##### <a name="-gnomish--application--entry_categories"></a>`entry_categories`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

Specify the application icons Categories entry.
Hint: becomes optional and unused when $ensure is set to absent.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-gnomish--application--entry_exec"></a>`entry_exec`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

Specify the application icons Exec entry.
Hint: becomes optional and unused when $ensure is set to absent.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-gnomish--application--entry_icon"></a>`entry_icon`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

Specify the application icons Icon entry.
Hint: becomes optional and unused when $ensure is set to absent.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-gnomish--application--entry_lines"></a>`entry_lines`

Data type: `Array`

You can add additional and free text entries line by line with this array. If your input includes one
of the other named entries the defined type will fail to avoid double entries to appear.

Default value: `[]`

##### <a name="-gnomish--application--entry_name"></a>`entry_name`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

Specify the application icons Name entry. If not explicitly set, the resource title you have chosen
while calling the defined type will be used.

Default value: `$title`

##### <a name="-gnomish--application--entry_terminal"></a>`entry_terminal`

Data type: `Boolean`

Specify the application icons Terminal entry. Valid values are false and true.

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-gnomish--application--entry_type"></a>`entry_type`

Data type: `String[1]`

Specify the application icons Type entry.

Default value: `'Application'`

##### <a name="-gnomish--application--entry_mimetype"></a>`entry_mimetype`

Data type: `Optional[Variant[Array, String[1]]]`

Specify the mime types supported by the application.

Default value: `undef`

### <a name="gnomish--gnome--gconftool_2"></a>`gnomish::gnome::gconftool_2`

Defined type that is used to configure Gnome system settings utilizing `gconftool-2`.

Instead of calling these defines directly, it is recommended to specify `$gnomish::settings_xml` or
`$gnomish::gnome::settings_xml` from hiera as a hash of group resources.
`create_resources()` will create resources out of your hash.

#### Examples

##### Hiera Example

```puppet
gnomish::settings_xml:
  '/desktop/gnome/background/picture_filename':
    value:  'wallpaper.png'

gnomish::gnome::settings_xml:
  'set GTK theme':
    key:    '/desktop/mate/interface/gtk_theme'
    value:  'Theme'
    config: 'mandatory'#

The above will set a wallpaper for mate desktops and change the GTK theme.
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `gnomish::gnome::gconftool_2` defined type:

* [`value`](#-gnomish--gnome--gconftool_2--value)
* [`config`](#-gnomish--gnome--gconftool_2--config)
* [`key`](#-gnomish--gnome--gconftool_2--key)
* [`type`](#-gnomish--gnome--gconftool_2--type)

##### <a name="-gnomish--gnome--gconftool_2--value"></a>`value`

Data type: `Variant[Boolean, Float, Integer, String]`

Used to pass the content of the setting you want to change.

##### <a name="-gnomish--gnome--gconftool_2--config"></a>`config`

Data type: `Variant[Stdlib::Absolutepath, Enum['defaults', 'mandatory']]`

You can specify which configuration source should get managed. For convenient usage, it allows to use defaults
and mandatory as acronyms for /etc/gconf/gconf.xml.defaults and /etc/gconf/gconf.xml.mandatory. If you want to
specify another configuration source, please specify the complete absolute path for it.

Default value: `'defaults'`

##### <a name="-gnomish--gnome--gconftool_2--key"></a>`key`

Data type: `String[1]`

To specify which key you want to manage. If not explicitly set, it will use the resource title you have chosen
while calling the defined type. See the example above for an example of both ways to pass the key name.

Default value: `$title`

##### <a name="-gnomish--gnome--gconftool_2--type"></a>`type`

Data type: `Enum['auto', 'bool', 'int', 'float', 'string']`

The default of auto will analyze and use the data type you have used when specifying $value. You can override
this by setting type to one of the other valid values of bool, int, float or string.

Default value: `'auto'`

### <a name="gnomish--mate--mateconftool_2"></a>`gnomish::mate::mateconftool_2`

Defined type that is used to configure Mate system settings utilizing `mateconftool-2`.
Up to now they have the same functionality and share the parameters names.

Instead of calling these defines directly, it is recommended to specify `$gnomish::settings_xml` or
`$gnomish::mate::settings_xml` from hiera as a hash of group resources.
`create_resources()` will create resources out of your hash.

#### Examples

##### Hiera Example

```puppet
gnomish::settings_xml:
  '/desktop/gnome/background/picture_filename':
    value:  'wallpaper.png'

gnomish::mate::settings_xml:
  'set GTK theme':
    key:    '/desktop/gnome/interface/gtk_theme'
    value:  'Theme'
    config: 'mandatory'

The above will set a wallpaper for mate desktops and change the GTK theme.
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `gnomish::mate::mateconftool_2` defined type:

* [`value`](#-gnomish--mate--mateconftool_2--value)
* [`config`](#-gnomish--mate--mateconftool_2--config)
* [`key`](#-gnomish--mate--mateconftool_2--key)
* [`type`](#-gnomish--mate--mateconftool_2--type)

##### <a name="-gnomish--mate--mateconftool_2--value"></a>`value`

Data type: `Variant[Boolean, Float, Integer, String]`

Used to pass the content of the setting you want to change.

##### <a name="-gnomish--mate--mateconftool_2--config"></a>`config`

Data type: `Variant[Stdlib::Absolutepath, Enum['defaults', 'mandatory']]`

You can specify which configuration source should get managed. For convenient usage, it allows to use defaults
and mandatory as acronyms for /etc/gconf/gconf.xml.defaults and /etc/gconf/gconf.xml.mandatory. If you want to
specify another configuration source, please specify the complete absolute path for it.

Default value: `'defaults'`

##### <a name="-gnomish--mate--mateconftool_2--key"></a>`key`

Data type: `String[1]`

To specify which key you want to manage. If not explicitly set, it will use the resource title you have chosen
while calling the defined type. See the example above for an example of both ways to pass the key name.

Default value: `$title`

##### <a name="-gnomish--mate--mateconftool_2--type"></a>`type`

Data type: `Enum['auto', 'bool', 'int', 'float', 'string']`

The default of auto will analyze and use the data type you have used when specifying $value. You can override
this by setting type to one of the other valid values of bool, int, float or string.

Default value: `'auto'`
